column1: Smoque BBQ////Smoque was everything you want in a BBQ place. Every single item that we had on the menu was pretty great! The mac and cheese was a bit on the sandy
column2: crumbled cheese side and not as rich and creamy as you'd like but the sliced brisket was EXCELLENT. Their sauces were obviously great (assuming that would make or break a BBQ joint) and I poured every ounce on my baby backs. The ribs themselves had a great charred smoked flavor but I'd say they were a tad stuck on the bone compared to others I've had. I would say that the seating arrangements aren't the greatest
column3: as I bumped and rubbed up on my neighbor as I sexually moaned and groaned as I devoured my lunch (This is just me getting picky). All in all
